references.paper_title: The microstructures of network recall: How social networks are encoded and represented in human memory
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the current work, as it establishes the scientific foundation for the experimental designs, including the memory clearance task and the analysis of biased patterns in graph recall.

references.paper_title: Humans use compression heuristics to improve the recall of social networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of compression heuristics in human graph recall, which is used as motivation and theoretical background for investigating whether LLMs use similar heuristics in their graph recall.
This paper explores how sex influences the accuracy of graph recall in humans, which inspires a mini-study to investigate if a similar effect exists in LLMs.

references.paper_title: Network motifs: simple building blocks of complex networks
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of network motifs (microstructural patterns) which is used as a theoretical basis for analyzing the microstructures of graphs recalled by LLMs.

references.paper_title: Forgetting in the recall-based elicitation of personal and social networks
references.reason: This paper provides insights into the forgetting mechanisms in human graph recall which is valuable for comparing with LLMs' behaviors.
